title:
Search for a light charged Higgs boson in $t \to H^\pm b$ decays, with
  $H^\pm \to cs$, in $pp$ collisions at $\sqrt{s}=13$ TeV with the ATLAS
  detector
abstract:
A search for a light charged Higgs boson produced in decays of the top quark,
$t \to H^\pm b$ with $H^\pm \to cs$, is presented. This search targets the
production of top-quark pairs $t\bar{t} \to Wb H^\pm b$, with $W \to \ell\nu$
($\ell = e, \mu$), resulting in a lepton-plus-jets final state characterised by
an isolated electron or muon and at least four jets. The search exploits
$b$-quark and $c$-quark identification techniques as well as multivariate
methods to suppress the dominant $t\bar{t}$ background. The data analysed
correspond to 140 $\text{fb}^{-1}$ of $pp$ collisions at $\sqrt{s} = 13$ TeV
recorded with the ATLAS detector at the LHC between 2015 and 2018. Observed
(expected) 95% confidence-level upper limits on the branching fraction
$\mathscr{B}(t\to H^\pm b)$, assuming $\mathscr{B}(t\to Wb) + \mathscr{B}(t \to
H^\pm (\to cs)b)=1.0$, are set between 0.066% (0.077%) and 3.6% (2.3%) for a
charged Higgs boson with a mass between 60 GeV and 168 GeV.
